summary: the 3′-untranslated region (UTR) of the BaMV RNA genome was mapped structurally into ABC (a cloverleaf-like), D (a stem-loop) and E (pseudoknot) domains. the baMV replicase complex that was isolated from the infected plants was able to recognize the 3′ UTR of PVX RNA to initiate minus-strand RNA synthesis in vitro. the bamboo mosaic virus (BaMV) has a single-stranded positive-sense RNA genome that is 6366 nt in length. two major subgenomic RNAs 2 and 1 kb in length share a 3′ co-terminus with genomic RNA. the open reading frames 1 to 5 encode polypeptides 155, 28, 13, 6, and 25 kDa in size. the cis-acting elements in the 3′ UTR of BaMV RNA for minus-strand RNA synthesis were identified in an in vitro replication assay. the replicase complex was derived from BaMV-infected
